column4: i've just had an interesting experience with installing ubuntu on a laptop
it must've been an issue with the win7 installation or something
it basically resulted in windows 7 not being able to be booted anymore.
In any case, what I had to do was wipe the entire drive, remove all partitions and start from scratch. That sucked since it had a bunch of data that'll take a while getting back.
the virtue of backups is a lesson you need not learn the hard way
had nowhere to backup to. either way, the files aren't "lost forever" as they can be redownloaded. it's just gonna take some time (30-40 GB of data)
you should always have somewhere to backup your files, otherwise your data isn't important to you
i keep an external harddrive just for backups
it was my brothers laptop, and the files lost was his World of Warcraft data and patches, hahaha
among a few other files, but all in all not a huge loss. Personally I have both cloud and local backup for the most important stuff :)
He has to, since he doesn't have anyone else to turn to for tech support. Nothing is worse than being on a techie's sh*tlist as we all know.. ;)
